intro: Habranthus cardenasianus, commonly known as the Cárdenas bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant has strap-like leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
